intro: Cephalorhizum popovii, commonly known as the Popov's corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant features a rhizomatous root system and has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of botanical circles.
